website_summaries.verdict: This challenging feeder will tap into your cat's curious side.
pros: We love that this feeder is designed for small paws
Won't snag as your cat swipes for its food
Tubes will activate your cat's senses
Works great for multiple cats with varying appetites
cons: The feeder may need to be modified to first appeal to your cat

customer_reviews.title: Neato
customer_reviews.text: It's worth $15 just to check your cats intelligence. One of my cat figured it out in 20 seconds and the other 2 just think I'm a jerk for putting treats where they can't reach....they don't make any effort..makes me feel bad for the brainy one for hanging out with idiots all day. Love them all of course
customer_reviews.author: s. aluminum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my boy...
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my boy. He loves feeding himself anyway. He would rather have the food on the floor or in a scooper so he can get it himself. I saw this for sale and had to buy it...he loves it and cries when the cups are empty...he's had it for three days. I called him over, dropped some food in the cups and told him to scoop the food out. Zero learning cure. A quick sniff then all hands in. Great idea, well made.
customer_reviews.author: A.Wit

customer_reviews.title: Not ADA compliant
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Maine Coon. He is polydactyl. Did not occur to me that his paws would never fit! Now he is depressed and questioning his being differently abled. Tension is mounting between him and my “normal” toed kitty (despite her inability to remove food even though her paws fit). He spends most of his days on the internet looking at perfect, photoshopped celebrity cat paws. He is demanding mittens. All I ever wanted was for him to feel confident in his own fur. But this has set us back. His therapy group is mostly dominated by cats with clipped ears, so he isn’t getting the support he needs.
customer_reviews.author: knitty

customer_reviews.title: Fat, Foul-Mouthed Cat Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple of days for my kitty to figure it out and there was much foul language from him while the treats remained elusive. Once he did figure it out, he took right to it and seems to enjoy the process of fishing food out. He's sort of a fatty, because he's a food junkie (along with being foul mouthed and fond of climbing Christmas trees to shout he's the king of the world), but I do believe there is one less roll on his pudgy backside. Great product. Very sturdy and entertaining, as well as effective!
customer_reviews.author: A ChristyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cats.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by so many positive reviews. I put my cat’s favorite treats in this toy and she just walked away. Tried to show her how to find them, but she showed no interest. She is a former barn cat and excellent mouser, so I was certain she would like this “find it” toys. I also purchased the catnip planter by the same company and could not get any catnip to grow. Both my cats wanted nothing to do with the Catit food tree. I don’t normally buy toys other than fuzzy mice & springs (their favorites) and ended up wasting a lot of money. Back to basics.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRODUCT ON THE MARKET FOR CATS!
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute JUNK! I had it for ten minutes and it fell apart. My cat had the cups (that come out very easily) all over the room. It came off the flimsy base in minutes and slid across the floor. This is not a well made product for any animal. It's cheaply made and is not intended for the purpose of a cat toy. I wanted a refund and never got it. Threw it in the garbage. The cups don't stay in, and the base is crap. DON NOT BUY!!!!! Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Raven Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: fun cat toy for rambunctious indoor cat
customer_reviews.text: fun digging toy for my Siamese mutt cat that was digging in the covered trash cans to find treasures prior to this. She doesn't use it as a feeder though. She seems to like the box it came in even more - has instructions of what to cut out to make it into another cat toy!
customer_reviews.author: Motek Fourtytwo

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money... I could have put cat food in muffin tins... The cats turn it over... The rubber base is creased...so it's not stable but I don't want to spend the money to send it back so we" ll pitch it
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Feeds (and entertains) my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a little overweight so I'm hoping this will slow down his eating. He was a bit confused- but intrigued- when I first set it up. After about fifteen minutes he figured out how it works, and so far seems to enjoy 'digging' for his food. No problems yet, but I'll update as necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Finn Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Not challenging for my cats
customer_reviews.text: The picture looks like my cats would enjoy it, but the product is not thoughtfully constructed. I have purchased other products by this company which I highly recommend so this one was a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: N2230

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory, but cat didn't get it, flimsy construction.
customer_reviews.text: Quick arrival, my cat couldn't figure it out so he is not using it. The plastic mat that it comes with is very flimsy and will not stay, it is hard to get the feeder to stay on the mat. Will likely be giving to Goodwill. In all fairness, I did not try to return the product or let the seller know I was not satisfied. Will maybe try again, but likely will go to Goodwill or in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed cat digger toy
customer_reviews.text: I doubt if my cats are exceptionally smart but it took them only a few minutes to figure out how to remove the green cups & dump all the food onto the floor. So I followed another customer's suggestion & put the food directly into the wells, which made it way too easy for them to get the food out. Also, the rubber ring that's supposed to keep the white dish anchored to the floor didn't help at all. The cats got the dish out of the ring and shoved it - and the ring - around. This is not well designed. Wish I hadn't bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Joan in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my scarf and barf cat
customer_reviews.text: It took the cat a few tries at first but she eventually got the hang of it. Each cat is different so how they eat, what they eat can't be compared to other cats. It also seems to keep her entertained as well.
customer_reviews.author: MassResTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bowl for bolters and entertaining for parents
customer_reviews.text: This cat bowl is wonderful. It makes my little girl dig for her food and slows her down considerably. Since using this we don’t have immediate meal returns. Those were common. Both of my cats took to it immediately. I can’t say enough about it. Small negative: the mat is useless in my opinion. It could be better designed or not used at all, I have the bowl in a corner so don’t need the mat. I just clean up kibble crumbs.’
customer_reviews.author: Jillcat

customer_reviews.title: Cat said: I don’t like your games, woman.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t figure out how she gets them out of the base but she pulls them every time, I don’t feed her again until she eats all the food she scatters which slows her down, but I don’t need the gadget for that.
customer_reviews.author: D5e

customer_reviews.title: but unless you put the treats they really like or else they are just too lazy to put ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to go along with some other Catit products. We are currently fostering and have a total of 3 cats in our house so we were looking for items to keep 2 of the kittens occupied. They were able to figure out how to use this (and so did our 2 dogs), but unless you put the treats they really like or else they are just too lazy to put forth the effort. Quality seems decent and I believe this will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chiquita BiancaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Moose cat LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for christmas for my cat Moose in 2018 and he loves it. It took him a couple days to figure out what to do with it and now he loves it. He was always sticking his paws in anything around the house with holes like the subwoofer and so I figured he would like this. Bought him a huge bucket container of treats and throw some in each cup every couple days and he goes over and digs out a snack every time he feels like it. My only issue with this is that my toddler thinks the cups are toys for him and pulls them out and walks around with them. lol.
customer_reviews.author: Coral Henney

customer_reviews.title: Slows down meal time and prevents vomiting
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a total food addict and every few days he eats so quickly that about 5 minutes later it all comes back up on my carpet. This bowl is fantastic. He figured it out right away and it slows meal time to about 10 minutes which keeps him busy and entertained as well as keeping his food down. The only piece I don't like is that it comes with this useless rubber mat that isn't attached so doesn't stay in place and the bowl scoots across the floor. I wish the unit just had rubber around the bottom instead.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity23

customer_reviews.title: Not long term entertainment for multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very sustainable toy. The Cats get bored very easily. Also the cups come out for cleaning purposes but our cats have no trouble pulling/knocking them out and loosing them. The grey matt that is supposed to keep the toy stable really has no great purpose. It just collects dirt and flips over.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Helps my cat eat slower
customer_reviews.text: My cat eats too fast and then throws up. This helps slow him down. He does a good job digging out his food!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Not for every feline
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept but if you get this for a fully grown cat who has really large paws it won't work, because he won't be able to get his paw into either the green vessels or the depressions. It would be best to buy it when the cat is young enough to have small paws and be e curious enough and determined enough to persist. The one star is just because our cat has really big feet and couldn't manage it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Wait til they give it a proper base. The rubber is always warped.
customer_reviews.text: Of all the catit items I’ve purchased this one is the worst. I would upload a photo but on my phone amazon seems to think it needs to control my camera even though the photo is already on my phone. I’ll add a photo when I get to a computer that amazon can’t try to say it needs camera control for. As for this item the rubber base is completely warped. Ugly and I can’t see any treason for the base to be cheap flimsy rubber instead of having a base like the catit feeding tree. The feeding tree btw the cats love. I use it for snacks. For this thing I’ll toss the rubber and go from there.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great for a fat cat
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. My cat was getting FAT because he started eating constantly and this did the trick. It's easy for him to get the food out but since it's kind of a pain in the ass for him to do it he only eats when he's actually hungry. After a few months he's lost a lot of weight and looks great so I couldn't reasonably ask for more. If your cat is becoming a grotesque lard-ass and you're worried about his enormous girth breaking the floorboards and sending him tumbling to his death then this is a great option to get him back to a normal weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jared D.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for our not too smart overweight cat
customer_reviews.text: We have one rather overweight cat and have always free fed our cats without issue. The overweight cat isn't overly bright so I was concerned about using this. He figured it out, took a couple of weeks but I'm no longer worried about his starving. This is not dog proof, however, so the dish still needs to be put where she cannot access it. It is rather large, so if space is an issue keep that in mind. Our cat has lost some weight as a consequence of his having to work for his food. The containers are a pain to fill, I always spill some, but it's worth it to have a healthier cat.
customer_reviews.author: puket3

customer_reviews.title: Helps my cat eat slower with more controlled portions
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little product to help my cat eat smaller portions and get some exercise. I don't think it would work well if your cat is declawed, but my cat has benefitted. I've tried large size kibble and small size kibble and both work fine for my little girl. Only complaint: the rubber base is ill-fitting and cheaply made. It doesn't anchor the product down sufficiently, and it tends to move. Perhaps a weighted base with a rubber rim would be a better design for the manufacturer to consider. Other than that, I could not be happier with the product!
customer_reviews.author: ASK26

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic cat toy. It is the only toy that sparks our cat's interest without fail. I use cat "dry food" and put about 3 pieces in each tube once or twice/day. Our cat LOVES "digging" into the tubes and picking out the food. This is his favorite toy!! I used the cat dry food because it has fewer calories than cat treats. I would definitely recommend this toy for all cats. Our cat has had many toys. I have given almost all of them away because he never uses them and loses interest quickly, even with interactive toys. This one is very special and never fails to get his attention!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Donovan

customer_reviews.title: so so awesome! My old boy loves it
customer_reviews.text: JUST got this yesterday and man o man my 15 year old and recently depressed furr ball LOVES IT i put his treats in the small ones and food in the big ones it took him just a few minutes to sniff and poke and lick before realizing how to use it perfect for me since he is actually interested in eating again
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our cat is a fan. We pair this with the Catit Senses 2.0 food tree and alternate putting his treat in this one and the other. It didn't take him a very long time to figure out how to dig out the treats from the cups, and he gets very excited when multiple cups contain treats. The rubber mat on the bottom is supposed to keep it from flipping or getting dragged when the cat plays, but our cat has found a way to loosen it and drag it around. Not sure if this is a design flaw or something specific to the particular item we received. Overall great toy though.
customer_reviews.author: Solanacea

customer_reviews.title: Just enough of a challenge for our persistent little chunk o' love kitty!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to slow our cat down with her eating, she is trying to lose some weight and is on a diet per her vet. This little set-up seemed a bit too daunting at first, we couldn't imagine her being able to get anything from the smaller cups, but she was able to get food out of both sizes of cups, one bit of kibble at a time. The little rubber ring around it doesn't help much to keep the area clean with our overeager eater, as the kibble flies all around the area when she really gets into the digging process. I would definitely recommend this feeder for any kitty who has the tendency to overindulge too quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Martin

customer_reviews.title: Product works just not for my fat cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and slow my cat down while he ate because he would always throw up afterwards. This did not slow him down at all and he would still throw up. It’s like it got him TOO excited to dig out the kibble. I gave it to a friend and their cat enjoys it and will dig treats out slowly instead of like my demon. The product works it just didn’t work for my extremely food motivated fatty. I ended up getting a slow feeder bowl for cats that had little fish at the bottom and that worked tremendously well and now it takes him forever to eat.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Tortures cats
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know why I bought this item. If you’re used to giving your cat treats a couple times a day and you start using this toy he will think he’s being punished. I’ve used it for a couple of days and now I think I’ll throw it in the trash. I don’t want to return an item that my cat used to eat with. It also makes a mess because the cat digs out the treats and often the treats break and go everywhere. I’m gonna go back to just giving my cat a handful of treats a day and stop torturing him with this device.
customer_reviews.author: An avid Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Great for bored and food motivated cats
customer_reviews.text: Once I set this up, my extremely food motivated cat started pulling treats out MOMENTS after I put it down for him. It is very easy for cats to learn too, my non-food motivated cats already can use this by watching the clever cat. All the cats love this, when I shake the treat container they all run to this to start pulling treats out. A good starter toy for enrichment for a bored cat, but my clever cat empties it too quickly. The down side is the rubber mat isn't directly connected to the toy, so a determined cat could flip it, if it is placed on carpet. Best if placed on wood, linoleum, or tile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy. My 10 month cat isn't a gobbler ...
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. My 10 month cat isn't a gobbler but he loves his food/treats and I wanted something engaging for him to do during the day while I'm at work. This feeder is fantastic. Like a lot of people I had to remove the green tubes first to get him to start using it (and not just trying to shove his head in). He got the hang of it quickly and I put half of his food during mealtimes into the feeder now, and leave some in there during the night for snacks (keeps me from getting woken up at 6am...). Good product and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: While neither of my cats have been successfully able to ...
customer_reviews.text: While neither of my cats have been successfully able to figure this thing out after a week, I don’t want to blame the product for it. The one extremely minor inconvenience I do have though, is that the base slides away from the placement pad every now and then- not really sitting as firm as one would hope. I hope my cats will figure it out eventually and will update this review at a later time about their experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Benitez

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. I though this would be a great started tool for my cat to learn a thing or two about working for his treats, and it doesn’t stay in place with the mat because the mat is warped and folded into a box for shipment, I tried warming it with my hair dryer and it didn’t even budge to flatten.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Herrera

customer_reviews.title: fun times
customer_reviews.text: We have one cat that is 2 years old and the other is 6 months old. So we are trying to have things that keep them busy and glad they both use this. Makes them work for their treats, ok for 2 seconds, but sometimes it is entertaining for us. Usually they will pick a side and both try to get their treats. But sometimes, one will pull it out and they other will scarf it up before the other can get to it. Love their expressions and what follows!
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: Cat never ever gets bored of this!
customer_reviews.text: This entertains my cat and she never gets bored of looking in there for treats. She goes to check it several times a day, to see if the treat fairy has been by. At first, she was not smart enough to get the treats out of the green cups, so i could only use the plain white indentations/cup holder areas, to put treats in. Overtime, she got the hang of it better and she can now get treats out of the green cups as well now. I have sent this to other cat owners as a gift, those cats looved it too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer33333

customer_reviews.title: Slow down kitty!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was gulping down his food. This has slowed him down! He has to work at getting his food which takes time. He was a fast learner. Took him about 5 min to figure out. The 2 things I don’t like...kind of messy. Pulling out the dry food with his paw then food lands on the floor. The other is the grey mat that holds the dish in place was messed up when I got it. It was like the mat was just a little to big for dish. That left a space between mat and dish where food got stuck. I’ll live with it. Otherwise I’d give it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Useless anti-skid mat doesn't fit at all
customer_reviews.text: Cat can't figure out how to get food. Came with a grey rubber (i assume no skid) mat that completely doesn't fit, that part is useless. I don't see a place for this item in our future. Update: cat has gotten a few pieces out of the green containers. I'm happy for that! I took a couple out, laid them sideways on the floor so she could bat the containers around and fish them out sideways. That seems to have helped. Love my smart kitty! Grey mat still hopelessly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CATIT DIGGER WORTH ITS WEIGHT IN GOLD
customer_reviews.text: In searching for something to keep my smart kitties stimulated and out of trouble, I found the Catit system and this cup digger 1st. All three of my kitties love this cup digger and can use it at the same time since it has x 5 cups and plenty of circumference for them all... and they're not skinny little wimpy cats!! Keeps them from moving things off my doll house and scratching up my furniture.. worth its weight in gold, I say!!The way they dig at their kibble and treats mixed in.. you'd think they were digging for gold hahahaha. Crazy Cat Lady
customer_reviews.author: DLJ Eugene

customer_reviews.title: May cause mess if your cat is an ice hole
customer_reviews.text: I had visions of my cat burning off some excess energy by gently and playfully digging for her food, the way “they do it in nature” or whatever they said in the product description. Well, my kitten is only 13 weeks old. Didn’t realize she took to this thing like an angry drunk losing at Monopoly. She wrecked this thing and tossed food all over her room. I just want her to burn off some energy so she quits torturing and stalking our malti-poo, who’s developing PTSD from being our kitten’s personal b...ch. maybe this will work for your cat? I’m gonna glue the tubes down and hide my blowtorch.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about this at first, because for about a week, it slowed our cat down enough that he completely stopped vomiting his food up. But then he got good enough at it that he can still eat remarkably quickly when he puts his mind to it. He's not vomiting his food up all over the house EVERY day like he was before, so I suppose that's an improvement, but it's still somewhat frequent. Also this is, by the very nature of the thing, far messier than his regular food bowl. Food and crumbs everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Good but your cat will learn how to game the system
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this cat feeder worked great for a month or so. Now our kitten has figured out how to pull the tubes out himself and dump all the food on the floor. Lol i still think it’s a good way to exercise your cats mind but beware it may only last a month. Maybe I’ll try to put something tacky at the bottom on each tube to hold them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: meh.
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 cats ... kitten figured this out, older cat could care less. The problem is that they are fed both wet and dry food and I will only use this for dry food. The kitten will dig out the food and eat maybe 1/2 of what she digs out, the rest just becomes a mess. It would likely be OK if the only option, but I think its more of a fun toy for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: sucess out of the box
customer_reviews.text: My cat ate out of this no problems as soon as i put her food in it. The cups come out so they're easy to clean and you can put the food in the base if your cat isn't ready for the cup level. You can also put water in the cups if your cat likes to play in water with their paws. The white base has a dip to catch all the food as your cat scoops it out. It catches a lot but my cat does end up flinging some of her food across the room with this feeder. Its a little smaller than i expected and that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: mii

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: My cat understood immediately and went to town on this. The green cups are removable, so if you want to add some extra challenge, remove the bottom three cups and only put food in the top two. Food will sometimes slide down into the bottom cups and the cat will have to fish it out twice. It's study and made of good plastic but prone to sliding if you don't use the rubber mat (it's totally optional). I'm considering giving these diggers as gifts; I know a few other cats with too much time on their paws.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I have put his regular dry food in the holes as well as treats that he likes. I thought he might work a little at a time but he cleans all the cups out at one time. He is fun to watch as he sniffs until he finds one that has some in it. Can a cat be left or right handed? Because he seems to favor using his left paw to his right one. Its educational for me because it does stimulate his hunting instincts.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not challenging at all
customer_reviews.text: This... is kind of dumb. Either that or my cats are super smart. It takes them no time at all to fish the treats out of the cups, there is no challenge whatoever. The cups can be removed for washing, but nothing holds them down at all so they can be lifted quite easily, including by the cats as they fish their treats out. It doesn't slow them from eating one bit. The rubber mat is just a ring that is not attached to the unit so it's also useless, I find.
customer_reviews.author: Book Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My cat took to this immediately. He dipped his paws in to get out kibble and a few treats. I even watched him scoop kibble out and eat it directly from his paw. He's a little chubby, so hopefully this will help him work for his food a bit. He even enjoyed playing with the packaging after I cut the holes out and stuck some of his toys inside. The mat that came with it went straight in the trash though, it was folded up and bent and seemed unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper66

customer_reviews.title: Both cats love this
customer_reviews.text: I have two ten-month-old Sibling kittens, and one is an eater and has become quite chubby. The other one picks at her food. It’s been hard to control the chubby one’s eating; they are so bonded they won’t eat unless they are together. I was thrilled when I took this out of the box last night and within 10 minutes, both cats were sticking their paws in the tubes to get the food out. One possible negative: when pulling food out of the middle tube this morning, one cat almost pulled the entire tray over. If that becomes a problem, I will just take out that particular tube.
customer_reviews.author: Devonator

customer_reviews.title: Our 2 Cats LOVE the Digger!
customer_reviews.text: Our two kitties with very different personalities and eating styles absolutely LOVE this! One of our cats has always enjoyed scooping food out of her dish with her big paw, bats it around to “kill” it, and then eats it. She is uber talented with the Catit Digger! Sometimes we put food in, sometimes treats, and sometimes we mix the two to keep ‘em guessing. If your cat loves treats, offer a treat by hand and let them get excited about it. Then offer another treat, but have your cat follow your hand to the Catit Digger and drop the treat in a cup. The scent should attract your cat, since cats have a hard time with closeup focus.
customer_reviews.author: C. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Took some time to adjust but now my cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 14 years old and as a senior has started to gain some weight. He also eats his food way too quickly which results in throwing up. I was looking for something to slow him down and for the throwing up to stop. Happy to report this product has really helped. It took him a few days to really get the concept and he started to not eat and drink a crazy amount. However after about a week he now knows what to do and has been using it well.
customer_reviews.author: G. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: My cat just looked at me as if to say ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat just looked at me as if to say, "Really?" Then he walked off. Again, what can I say? He's a cat...
customer_reviews.author: Texas Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Slowed down the gorging
customer_reviews.text: My cat does separate the bowl from the rubber mat that's suppose to keep it in place, but that's when he's one pissed off Joe because he has to reach way down in the cup to get the last of his kibbles. Its definitely slowed his gorging down so the after math of puked up half chewed cat food land mines are less. Of course the dog is not too happy about that part.... he's never been picky when it comes to eating ABC kibbles. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: In the cat toy rotation.
customer_reviews.text: Like most cat toys, the cats are interested for awhile, but easily tire of it so in the closet it goes for a week or few, then I'll pull it back out and they'll be interested for a day or two. Then we start all over again. I imagine kittens would be more interested in this for a longer time. There is another brand that is more challenging, but it's impossible to get at this time. My cats aren't especially food driven, so that might account for their tepid interest in this toy. If you have a food driven cat, they'll probably have far more fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: dfwdxb

customer_reviews.title: Kitty is learning how to use it
customer_reviews.text: The feeder and holders are sturdy and stable. The 'skirt' bottom does not fit the holder bowl as it is crimped and so won't stay on. I posed a question with no answer nor has the seller responded to the question I posted, so I don't guess they are monitoring for questions. My new kitty likes to play with her food and this looked appropriate for her to have stimulating play with and yet eat. It work, it just doesn't have the "skirt".
customer_reviews.author: animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Great for helping my cats get healthier!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous purchase for ny cats! We got this and the catit tower. Our cats used to eat really fast and then throw up. Now they eat less and much slower. They are losing weight and are more playful! They dont care for the track, but it looks really nice all set up. I definitely leveled up in cat mom status with this purchase. I encouraged others to try it too. Very happy with both this and the tower. 2 of our cats prefer the tower, but one likes this better.
customer_reviews.author: Alix

customer_reviews.title: Super pleased
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My male cat over-grooms like crazy so my vet recommended giving him a bit more to keep him occupied in case part of the problem is inactivity/boredom. This unit has slowed down his eating and made him use his little brain more. He yells at us throughout the day as if he has no food and/or cannot figure it out, however, when our backs are turned he eats just fine. Do not be duped. My female cat has also benefited from this feeder as she is smarter and quicker than her dopey brother and thusly gets more food than she did before. Overall, this was a great purchase that I recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps because my cat is fourteen or perhaps because the only thing she will eat is her standard cat food, she was not patient enough to work with this Digger. It was a total flop. Also, the Digger that I received did not have the same functions as the photo had indicated. There was some sort of inset where the cat would slid the treat/food to enable her to eat it. That was not included in my box. Since my cat did not have the patience or interest in the item, I donated it to a local thrift store. I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Huff

customer_reviews.title: cats seem to like and use it
customer_reviews.text: im glad I bought it. I usually give my 3 cats a handful of treats in the morning and they devour them in 30 seconds and instantly want more. so I bought this and did what 1 reviewed suggested - to introduce it to them without the green tubes 1st. so that's what I did. 1 cat (special needs cat) immediately figured out how to get the treats, the 2nd cat took about 2 hours and the 3rd cat (the smartest one) just waited to eat the ones that fell out of the tubes when the other 2 cats dropped them. but, he uses the tubes now and they all like it.
customer_reviews.author: clever1

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cats that eat too fast
customer_reviews.text: Adopted a cat who was once a stray and probably struggled for food, and if you put a bowl of food out he will eat it so fast he gets sick and vomits. This product has worked wonders for slowing him down so he doesn't vomit. The only reason i gave 4 stars rather than 5 is because little guy ended up getting some cuts on his chin from trying to stick his face in the tubes as well as some of the fur gone on his nose, this could just be our cat, and that he is a bit crazy when it comes to eating.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Berg

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE this!!!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats really love this feeder. To encourage their interest initially, I added some freeze-dried minnows to the cat food, and it sure worked. It only took a minute for my 16 year old boy to figure out how to fish food out. It's actually quite cute how he will fish a piece of food out and eat it right from his paw. He's fairly big and lazy, (and really loves food!), so I'm hoping puzzle feeders will slow down his eating. I wish they had even longer tubes to increase the challenge a bit, but as it is it really makes eating a game for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L

customer_reviews.title: Fun Slow Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! Love to see them learning how to get food out of the tubes or whatever it's called. My female kitten (poppy) somehow smarter, she managed to pick out the food really quick but the male (Tiger) was just sitting there and watching her ate one by one. He did tried but ended up stuck his head inside the tube. Anyway, this slow feeder works best with kittens cause my older cat could easily turn that up side down.
customer_reviews.author: Khoa

customer_reviews.title: They love it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something for my 3 year old cat who is more like a 3 month old kitten! He's wild and loves to play. I feel like he gets bored so I wanted something challenging and this is perfect.I put treats and little morsels of kibble and he goes to town. He loves getting them out and afterwards he seems tired, which is our goal. This is amazing with little pieces or meat or cheese too or even putting small toys in so they keep busy for a while.
customer_reviews.author: TBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: What a great little puzzle bowl!
customer_reviews.text: I adore this little puzzle bowl, it's very well made and the rubbery mat that goes under it eliminated the issue we had with the last puzzle where our cat would just scoot the bowl around when he was trying to dig. It's well made, and not an ugly mismash of offensively bright colors like a lot of cat things are. Now our kitty can't eat at lightning speed and make himself sick, so it's a win for him AND a win for my carpets.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Works for some cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not use this at all. Filled with treats and then also regular food as well. No response to either. Tried to show her how to dig them out and pulled out the containers so she could smell the food better, but no luck. I re gifted it to my sister and she has two cats. She said she has never seen or heard either of them pawing at the digger, but when she comes home from work, it is empty. So her cats have the concept down and seem to enjoy the food when mom is not home to fill the food dish.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand the point of this
customer_reviews.text: It's not a "game" because the cats just reach into cups and get treats out. It's not a feeder because it doesn't hold enough food. It's just useless. Unlike all my other Catit 2.0 products, this is the only one I regret buying.
customer_reviews.author: Paola

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good for slowing down eating
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our new cat who quickly went from a growing kitten to a heckin chonker. To make things worse he was gorging himself on the other cats’ food too and causing tension. This feeder is pretty good, and it took our little tubby cat about two weeks to figure out how to scoop more than one pebble at a time out of it. It’s effective for slowing him down and that’s the point of this product. Four stars :)
customer_reviews.author: ProfessorWC

customer_reviews.title: My boy cats love this game!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this game! I put treats inside of the tubes and they go for it and dig them out! The only negative thing I can say about it is that when it came package the rubber piece to hold it to the floor was bent so it never work correctly like it was supposed to but we made do with what we had. Well I can definitely recommend this for your cats to challenge them to learn how to eat slower and grab treats.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: Great instinct satisfier with a bonus box!
customer_reviews.text: Be warned, it can be messy since your kitty needs to dig their food out! But it’s a great quality and is fun for my cat. He digs around his bowl to try and cover it, and this product helped satiate his instinct to bury! The only issue I have is with the silicone pad on the bottom, it was folded so there are crinkles that make it not stick to the bowl tightly. Otherwise, it’s amazing quality... AND, the box turned into a little maze toy that my little man loves!
customer_reviews.author: Torin Perrett

customer_reviews.title: Great slow feeder. Bottom of cups is tricky.
customer_reviews.text: We got this to slow our piggy cat down as he was always grazing and started looking chunky. This has definitely worked! I believe it’s helping his mental stimulation as well as slowing the rate he grazes. The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because I find that neither of our cats can quite empty any of the containers. They can get close but ultimately neither of them (1.5 year male and 11 year female) can fully empty any of the cups which means we have to dump that for them or continue to add more at a quicker rate than it seems like we should have to.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gang

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but frustrates the kitten.
customer_reviews.text: This comes with very little assembly and is easy to use. We bought this to slow our 9-month old kitten when she is eating. It works very well for that, but it seems to frustrate her quite a bit. She has no problem finding the food or treats, no does she have an issue getting them out of the tubes. It does seem to make her a bit frantic during the process. To combat that we give her some on the device and some in the tubes. Seems to work out better. We also pick it up and put it away when it is empty as the kitten thinks if it is out, there is food in it.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: A bit interesting for them
customer_reviews.text: Edit - I have changed this to 5 stars because my puppy thinks it’s the best toy in the world. I put one treat in each thing and he plays with it for like 15-20 minutes getting them out. 5 stars for dogs, 4 stars for cats I have three cats. I haven’t really seen them use it often but I do see the treats slowly disappearing, so they must use it when I’m not around. I managed to catch one baby using it but she only took one treat and then walked away.
customer_reviews.author: Becky54

customer_reviews.title: excellent idea
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is great! It slows my cat down and mealtime lasts two minutes instead of two seconds. Yes, he is a gobbler. Eats too fast. This feeder not only makes him work a little but makes him think because I don't use all the cups all the time. He has to figure out which cups have food and which are empty. Not a problem for him. He also had no trouble at all figuring out how the feeder works. Whoever thought of this must be part cat. It is definitely a good challenge for an indoor cat who is often bored out of his skull.
customer_reviews.author: sopraminervaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Solves messy eater problem! (edit: temporarily)
customer_reviews.text: Our cat is a really messy eater. When she eats out of a regular bowl, even a wide one, she likes to toss her dry food around and leaves it everywhere. With this device, she has to fish out each piece of food before eating it. No more having to sweep up around her bowl twice a day! She had no problem figuring out how to get food out of it; it was pretty much instant. Edited: Well, it's gotten too easy for her. She now gets food out of it so readily that things are as messy as before, alas.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Great fun feeder! I wasn’t sure that my cats will like it but they really do! It is smaller than it looks on the photos which is great for me because I didn’t want this to take a lot of space in my kitchen. I have one cat who eats without control and stuffs himself for minutes. This definitely helped him to slow down and to eat less food within longer period of time because if he eats from a food bowl he is like a vacuum cleaner... food disappears for minutes. My second cat wouldn’t eat unless he plays with the food so this feeder solved both kitties problems.
customer_reviews.author: Maya G

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much we got a 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: Our cats loved the first one so much we just bought them a second one. They love digging the food out of the cups even more than they liked watching the food drop from the Catit Food Tree feeder. Also helps with gorging/fast eating as they have to take the time to work the food out of the cups. Our cat Puddy will pull out a bunch of food at once then gobble it up so be aware, your feline will find ways around the entire principle of this feeder. That said, we’ve seen much less regurgitating of food.
customer_reviews.author: Snartky

customer_reviews.title: Too loose
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the concept of this, and I do enjoy that my cat has to do a little extra work for her food, but the containers come out way too easily, my cat pops them out when she is trying to get food, then she plays with it, and I’m looking all around the house for the containers. I may try some Velcro, but I feel like something like that should have been included to keep them from falling out.
customer_reviews.author: RobbieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stick to floor
customer_reviews.text: I suppose if you have a kitten who is learning about a new environment, this could be a little useful and fun. But for an adult cat, this thing is kind of useless. My Georgie knocks this thing all over the floor, despite the rubber bottom. He also figured out the toy in 2 seconds, and can get multiple treats out with one paw. I should have known better - my hopes for an entertaining and tricky toy were too high.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great for food motivated cats
customer_reviews.text: If you have difficulty getting an overweight cat to slow their eating down and stop asking for food all the time, this could be your answer. My cat uses it as his only food bowl. He puts his little paws in and scoops the food right out. So cute to watch and keeps him busy, which has helped with some agression issues too. It is not for every cat, as my other cat is not very food motivated and has never attempted to use it. I feed them separately and the cat I bought it for knew how to use it right away. It has helped him to stop gobbling up all the food in 3 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Kohaku Lea

customer_reviews.title: This company and their products are fantastic. They make things that cats are just drawn ...
customer_reviews.text: This company and their products are fantastic. They make things that cats are just drawn to. This was my third purchase of one of their products and we have a cat that is on the heavier side who likes to just sit at the bowl until it's gone. We've stopped feeding them as much and this is the perfect replacement. They knew immediately what to do and it slows down the food intake at one sitting. The only thing you have to watch out for is them knocking it around a lot, we have found placing it on a rug instead of the hardwoods helped ;)
customer_reviews.author: Rick Houston

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a nicely made & useful product
customer_reviews.text: My Savannah cat, Oakley, quickly figured this out. I put 2-4 treats in each cup, he pawed at them for a little bit but eventually was smart enough to use his paws and mouth to pick the cups up out of the white base and then dump them on the ground. I think I'll try to glue the cups to the base and see if that will make him work for the treats. Overall, nicely made product, quality is above average, comes in a very sturdy/useful box that has directions on making a cat maze out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it, helps slow their feeding down
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats love this, well more accurately i love this for my 2 cats. It helps prevent them from gorging themselves on their food, and challenges them at the same time. I just had to show them how to do it once and they were off to the races ever since. If you have a problem with your cat eating too fast or too much check out this item its great. Also the box its shipped in you can turn into a toy! which ended up being hilarious, until the one cat decided it was easier to just chew through the space and tear out one of the box walls to get to the treats!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: my cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how my very old cat, 17 yrs, enjoys digging into these tubes. I place a few temptations treats in each chamber and add a few pieces of dried cat food on top. He loves going after them, pulling them up and eating them. He won't eat the dry food very often but when he has to work for it, he devours it- as long as there is the occasional treat. He now gets our attention and demands we fill up the toy for him with his treats and food. We've created a monster, but when you are that old, you deserve lots of treats.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Way too easy for kitties
customer_reviews.text: My cats got the treats out wayyyyy to quickly. I should have just handed them the treat directly. I'm curious as to what type of cats this was tested on, but to my always eager for a treat kitties, this was no contest. The ball that the cats have to roll around to get the treat to fall out i MUCH better than this. It may work for cats that are declawed or are on the larger side. My cats deftly curled their paws and claws to cup and pull the treat right out. And to make it worse, returning it is half the price of the product. I'm pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Joy Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Ok but with major design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This item is a good idea but the maker fails to follow through on the overall design. The rubber flap surrounding the main plastic piece is completely useless and does not fit snugly or attach in any way to the plastic it surrounds. My cats like the holes for the food and are able to use the product but it is constantly moving across the floor because the rubber piece doesn't do what is is intended for.
customer_reviews.author: skink

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried at first that Freyja would have trouble figuring it out, but it barely took a day for her to catch on. What's even better is that no matter how smart she is she can't cheat on it like she did on her kibble ball; the dexterity it requires keeps her from binging. Also, since Juno can't figure it out, I don't have to worry about Juno stealing Freyja's food if he gets past the cat gate.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: The digger makes your cat work for his treats/meals.
customer_reviews.text: A neat way to parcel out treats or regular dry food. My cat figured out how it works after studying it for about 45 seconds. The only downside is that he empties it too fast and whines around for refills. I have to keep track so I don't overdo it. The digger is well made and should be easy to clean. I like the added “apron” that fits around the bottom. Eliminates the normal spills around a regular bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Kitty plays with this food a little less now
customer_reviews.text: Before the Digger, kitty would bat his treats around the floor of the kitchen before either eating them or getting them stuck under the fridge. Now kitty only gets treats from these cups. He might still bat it around a few times, but he plays with his food less after digging it out. I only wish there were some cups that were a little more challenging for him to get food out.
customer_reviews.author: mcfingrs

customer_reviews.title: Best $ ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: I have been raving about this product since I received it a week ago! My 17 year old Tropicana was a traditional "gobbler" eating everything put in front of him and vomiting it all right after. He loves this contraption so much. It is like a little game and he has to eat one or two niblets at a time. No more gobbling or vomiting....I'm still amazed!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Dalanni

customer_reviews.title: When food it life...
customer_reviews.text: I truly do not believe my kitten to be the smartest kitten out there. We noted he was getting little big in the belly, being indoor only kitten we worry about being overweight... so hey lets try this feeding toy.... well I am not sure that is how it is suppose to work but he is working for his food and eating slower. LOL he just pulled the green canisters out of the holes and dumps them over to get to the food.
customer_reviews.author: D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those troublemaker cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food toy; he took to it right away. It has helped his crazy behavior (pulling everything out of the cabinets, trying to eat through everything, clawing up the doors) so much now that he has something to keep him busy. And he leaves some food to eat for later as well now which was unheard of! Fantastic product!!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Roy

customer_reviews.title: 100 times yes
customer_reviews.text: This feeder keeps my kitty eating for 5x time longer than a plain dish of food. He throws up when he eats too much, and this has helped remedy that. A great feeder for cats that eat too fast, too much, and need some extra stimulation in there day. I don't think i need to buy it again because it's REALLY STURDY and GREAT QUALITY! But if the situation called for it, I totally would. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lop

customer_reviews.title: A hit with my senior cat
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and easy to use, so it was money spent. Beginners tip: take out some of the green tubes and put a hard treat or two in the empty holes - cats can see the treat against the white plastic. When they understand the game, put the tubes back in. I found the non-slip part hard to install so it went in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Keeps them curious
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats now refuses to accept treats unless I put them in this and he begs all day for it. He now eats his wet food out of his regular bowl like it's treats in a tube which is funny and messy. My other cat is terrified of this. But he's kind of dumb so his opinion doesn't count. Would definitely recommend for curious cats.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great for "Digger Cats"
customer_reviews.text: This toy really does cater to cats who like to Dig. I did put my fingers into some of the tubes to demonstrate but honestly, they figured it out on their own. We do give our gatos treats once or twice per week but this toy is a stimulating way for them to get their own "prize". We have a couple of cats who aren't really into the hunting-on-the-ground thing but, our other two love it. I will likely purchase this toy again for friends of mine with cats.
customer_reviews.author: D. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Slowed our cars down, great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 of these for our three cats. They were eating too much too fast, so we wanted something to slow them down a little. These worked great. One caveat, we superglued the bowls into their spots (one cat would just pull the cups out and dump them). These are neat though. They have a little silicone skirt thing that helps them stay in place, and the cups are a good depth to make the cats work for it, but not totally frustrate them. I would only fill the cups about 1/3 full though, so if you have a couple cats and don’t want to refill it 10 times a day, maybe consider two of these?
customer_reviews.author: Wil Ray

customer_reviews.title: Weird mat, otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to slow down my chonker a bit at the food bowl and keep my active one entertained for awhile. I get glared at a bit when I put the food in there but he eventually caves and eats his food, with some attitude. Now if I could figure out how to keep my sisters dog from dismantling the whole thing when she comes over. Only took a star off because it's kind of awkward to get it to sit in the rubber mat correctly. And then the darn thing always gets pushed off somehow. I dont think it's even on the mat right now.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Great product idea, but Didn't keep em  busy very long
customer_reviews.text: This fedder comes with a rubber gasket to keep it from being pushed across the floor, but it never fits quite right on the bottom and ends up moving a bit on my wood floors. I do like that it come apart and can go in the dishwasher. It doesn't slow my two little beasts down very much (honestly the box that it came in which can be made into a puzzle box and that worked better in terms of entertainment and slow eating).
customer_reviews.author: Cool Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Solved my cat's weight issue
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats, and only 1 of them overfeeds. I started getting very worried for her with how much weight she was packing on, so I decided to try the digger. Much to my delight, it absolutely saved my kitty from obesity. She'll always be a little chubby, but she's a much healthier weight and we can still "free feed" our cats. I recommend trying the digger to anyone having issues with kitty-obesity.
customer_reviews.author: Leena

product_meta.title: Catit Senses 2.0 Digger Interactive Cat Toy
product_meta.description: Size:1-PackThe Catit Senses 2.0 Digger Cat Toy encourages cats to work for their dry food/treats in a fun and natural manner. As cats are true hunters, they need to be able to search and locate food in different locations around the house; our cat feeder toy incorporates this idea with a smart design that activates your cat's natural foraging behavior during playtime. Hiding dry kibble or treats in the Digger's multiple tubes plays on a cat's instincts to sniff and paw, while also acting as a cat slow feeder so they eat smaller portions. An interactive cat toy or feeder is a great way to stimulate activity while reducing binge eating! The slow feeder cat bowl comes equipped with 3 short-narrow tubes, 2 long-wide tubes, a stable base and a rubber mat to lock the product in place. This cat puzzle feeder is also super easy to disassemble and clean; simply remove the green tubes from the food bowl and handwash. We recommend that you handwash this item with natural soap (free of abrasive materials and water). Catit is focused on creating cat enrichment activities for all cats especially indoor cats. Cat toys for indoor cats should encourage a cat’s natural foraging and hunting behaviors. Our Catit Senses 2.0 line has created a wide variety of cat toys, with this in mind. To keep your cat interested, you need to change their cat toys set-up often, Catit Senses 2.0 is the only cat toy series that allows you to create new and exciting setups for your cat, quickly and easily! Each toy was designed to activate and stimulate your cat's unique senses, all in one fresh, green style to match any home interior, no matter the arrangement.
feature_bullets: Cat slow feeder designed to help greedy eaters eat at a healthier pace
The cat food bowl features multiple tubes that stimulate natural pawing behavior in a fun manner
This cat puzzle is for use with dry kibble and treats
Easy to disassemble and clean; simply remove the rounded green tubes from the food bowl and handwash
Rubber mat secures the cat bowl into place to prevent tipping
Catit Senses 2.0 is a product line developed to activate your cat’s senses; Our cat toys encourage your cat to use sight, smell, taste, touch and hearing to stimulate their natural instincts indoors

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,586 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
